review_title: Great school that gives students a quality education
pros: Solid teachers, course offerings at a great price.
cons: Wish it could be a 4-year school.

pros: The students are great, and if you are a good teacher, you're not micromanaged. You can also teach a variety of in-person and online courses if you want.
cons: The administration is a mess. The president should have been removed with a vote of no confidence years ago. No stable Academic VP, no stable deans, and the deans and VPs have tons of responsibilities also for low pay, so they leave as soon as they can get out. The pay would be fine, but the president screams at people when they're still trying to learn and has no idea how to run a school outside of getting the board to think he's amazing. COVID was mismanaged and since then the halls have been empty and no one seems to know what to do other than giving more high school classes college credit.

pros: Not many the money wasn't bF
cons: Management was horrible, multiple doh violation

pros: The community is welcoming and staff is cooperative.
cons: The living was expensive and wanted to seek better opportunity

review_title: A bit of freedom, not much inspiration
pros: I took this job because I was moving to the region anyway, and had experience in the position being offered. Because the place is pretty much dysfunctional, if you have focus and can be assertive, you can get some new initiatives adopted. It is easy to be a relatively big fish in this small pond.
cons: There are a lot of longtime employees here who really do the minimum and nothing more. Also, the Board of Trustees wield way too much power and, often, act shady, hiring "friends and family," vs. the most qualified applicant. Even by community college standards, the level of student is often poor. They need a lot of help, and they are not getting it by the Academic division, which seems to be more about politics than success.

pros: A very challenging work environment.  Really gives you the opportunity to develop your own teaching style and experience with some great students.
cons: As an adjunct, there are no benefits.  The salary is substandard and the faculty treat you like a substandard professor.  There is also no real opportunity for career advancement.

pros: I was in a situation in which I had no real supervision and was able to do whatever I wanted in the classroom. In many ways, the School is so unorganized and chaotic, they really don't have the wherewithal to track faculty success.
cons: The facility needs improvement and the admin needs to stop treating students as children.

pros: Educational Institution.  Good opportunity for teaching experience.
cons: Little room for advancement.  Salary may be low for area.

review_title: You will love your colleagues, but hate your life.
pros: The students and faculty are amazing - teaching-wise, it is a fabulous place to work.
cons: Administration fights faculty at every turn; salaries are an average of $15,000 below market average; faculty go many years between contract negotiations without cost of living increases; workload is ridiculous.

Academic Affairs does not provide a colleagial environment at the higher education level. Micro-managed in terms of reviewing your communication with colleagues as well as micro-managing your classroom and teaching pedagogy.

pros: location, dress code, cost to attend,
cons: salary, deans, too political, no raises
